author: Slidebean
description:
New York’s pricing transparency law reveals how little transparency really means.

New York’s new law requires retailers to notify consumers when algorithmic pricing is used for essential goods.
However, it stops short of mandating disclosure of pricing logic, comparisons, or outcomes.

While the regulation creates compliance overhead and a paper trail for regulators, it leaves consumers without meaningful insight into how prices are determined.
The result is awareness without accountability, proof that transparency laws can exist without true transparency.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: Stores now have to tell you when prices are personalized

author: Slidebean
description:
⚡ Upgrade your brain with The Hustle newsletter: https://clickhubspot.com/f81cec
-
OpenAI announced a $25B data center in Argentina — but nobody seems to know where it’s actually being built.
In this video, we travel to Patagonia to investigate why OpenAI would place one of the world’s largest AI data centers in a region facing power shortages, droughts, and political volatility.

What we found was a trail of vague announcements, phantom companies, energy bottlenecks, and unanswered questions about water, power, and who really benefits from this deal.
This is the real cost of scaling AI — and why where data centers are built matters more than anyone wants to admit.
